Download all available integrated rounds from the European Social Survey

Download all available integrated rounds from the European Social Survey

ess_all_rounds(your_email, only_download = FALSE, output_dir = getwd(),
  format = "stata")

Arguments

your_email

a character vector with your email, such as "your_email@email.com". If you haven't registered in the ESS website, create an account at http://www.europeansocialsurvey.org/user/new
only_download

whether to only download the files as Stata files. Defaults to FALSE.
output_dir

a character vector with the output directory in case you want to only download the files using the only_download argument. Defaults to your working directory. This will be interpreted as a directory and not a file name. Files names will be used as folder names, such as "./myfile.dta/.
format

the format from which to download the data. Can either be 'stata', 'spss' or 'sas', with 'stata' as default. When only_download is set to TRUE, the data will be downloaded in the format specified. If only_download is FALSE, the data is downloaded and read from the specified format (only 'spss' and 'stata' supported, see details).

Value

if only_download is set to FALSE it returns a list with all the latest rounds. If only_download is set to TRUE and output_dir is a valid directory, it returns the saved directories invisibly and saves all the rounds in the chosen format in output_dir

Details

If only_download is set to FALSE, the data will be read in the format specified in format. 'sas' is not supported because the data formats have changed between ESS waves and separate formats require different functions to be read. To preserve parsimony and format errors between waves, the user should use 'spss' or 'stata'.

Examples



# NOT RUN {
# Will download all rounds and return a list with each one
ess_all_rounds("your_email@gmail.com")

# Will download all rounds to the directory below
# as .dta files and won't return the rounds in R.

dl_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "mydownloads")

ess_all_rounds("your_email@gmail.com", only_download = TRUE, output_dir = dl_dir)
# }
